peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to get a rare book appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: There are people who specialize in appraisals of antiquities including books. Just type into your search engine book appraisers (and the city you live in if desired). There are also auction house such as Sothebys, Christies, Doyle and Heritage that will appraise any highly valuable object for a fee.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How does one become a rare books appraiser? - Quora

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you find the value of a rare book?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Websites. Start your research by checking used and rare bookseller websites that bring together sellers' prices. Remember, prices you find on bookseller websites include the dealer's markup, so you shouldn't expect to necessarily sell for that much up front.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Evaluating Old Books - Enoch Pratt Free Library

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out how much my old books are worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Specialized businesses such as auction houses and antiquarian booksellers can help you appraise individual books and larger collections. Contact information for specialists to authenticate or appraise your item can be found through professional organizations such as the American Society of Appraisers.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How much is my book worth? - Ask a Librarian - Library of Congress

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I find out if a book is rare?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: In simple terms, books achieve a degree of rarity only when demand exceeds supply. Unfortunately, there are no easy formulas for determining rarity. In the market-driven society in which we live, rare often equates with a high dollar value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How do I know if I have a rare book worth money? - Biblio
